News Release: 

�Samurai� a 2-hour special program on the Samurai warrior
will debut on the History Channel on December 8, from 9:00-11:00pm and
again on December 9 from 1:00-3:00am and on December 13, from
10:00-12:00pm.   Please check your local listings for airing times or go to
historychannel.com. for more details. 

According to the History Channel
press release: 
The knights of medieval Japan, the Samurai held power for
over 700 years. Ferocious in combat, these masters of sword and bow were
bound by an unforgiving code of ethics. Their legacy of martial artistry,
ceremony, self-discipline, and tenacity persists. Explore the history and
mystery of this elite warrior class as present-day Samurai demonstrate
their ancient skills in this 2-hour special, and historians and experts
examine the meaning and ritual of Bushido--the way of the warrior. TV PG 


The program will feature an interview with Rev. Kensho Furuya, Chief
Instructor of the Aikido Center of Los Angeles, in Little Tokyo, and noted
author, historian and expert on the Samurai sword.
